title: How to Make Cupcake Shoes

steps.headline: Decide what color you want your cupcake heels to be.
steps.description: Use white if you want to simplify the process, since you won’t need to color your frosting. Choose red, yellow, purple, blue or any other color. Brown shoes can be made using chocolate frosting, rather than coloring white frosting.

steps.headline: Purchase cupcake liners in a matching color or pattern.
steps.description: The liners make up the platform of your heel, so they should be color coordinated to your frosting and decorations.

steps.headline: Buy coordinating sprinkles.
steps.description: Try something that matches the color of your frosting. You can also use toasted coconut.

steps.headline: Mix your cake batter according to the package directions.
steps.description: Preheat your oven to the temperature specified.

steps.headline: Line your cupcake pan with your colored cupcake liners.
steps.description: If you are using chocolate cake mix, but you don’t want your cupcake shoes to appear brown, use two cupcake liners for each cupcake. The oil in the cake can seep through the liner and make it opaque.

steps.headline: Bake your cupcakes according to the package directions.
steps.description: Test them by poking a metal skewer into the center. If it comes out clean it is done.

steps.headline: Set the cupcakes to cook for one hour.
steps.description: Your cupcakes should be at room temperature before you try to frost them. Set them atop a mesh cooling rack to help them cool off faster.

steps.headline: Scoop the white frosting into a bowl.
Color your frosting to match the cupcake liners and sprinkles.
steps.description: Visit the Food Network’s Frosting by Numbers page to learn how to mix almost any color with traditional liquid food coloring. You can also purchase gel food coloring at craft stores or online. It is pre-mixed to a certain hue and it can result in more vibrant colors. This is the best option if you want to make red or black frosting.

steps.headline: Mix the frosting well with a spoon until all of the food coloring is combined.
Frost each of the cupcakes in an even layer with a rubber spatula.
steps.description: You can also pipe the frosting onto the top of the cupcake if you are experienced with cake decorating.

steps.headline: Pour your sprinkles or coconut flakes into a bowl.
steps.description: Dip the top of your iced cupcake into the sprinkles. They should be covered in an even layer, which will create the “fabric” of your shoe.

steps.headline: Place a large baking sheet on a flat surface nearby.
steps.description: This is where you will leave the finished product to dry.

steps.headline: Tailor your graham crackers.
steps.description: Take a rectangular piece of cracker from the box. Use a serrated knife to saw the graham cracker into an angled shoe platform. You will need a base to connect with the cupcake and a thinner top edge to connect with the heel. It will look like a long, thin triangle; however, both ends should have square sides for added support. Repeat with your 11 remaining graham crackers. Some crackers may fracture, so have extra on hand.

steps.headline: Ice the top of the graham cracker with your colored icing.
steps.description: Extend the icing along the edges of the cracker. Dip each edge of the graham cracker into the bowl of sprinkles. The sprinkles should look like the perimeter of the shoe. You can also pipe matching frosting or decorative beads onto the edges of the cracker. Set your iced crackers aside until you are ready for final assembly.

steps.headline: Cut your pirouette cookies.
steps.description: Cut the top of the Russian cigarette cookies into an angle. The graham cracker platform will rest on the top of the cookie. The shorter and more stout the cookies are, the sturdier the stiletto will be.

steps.headline: Melt white chocolate chips in the microwave with a little water.
steps.description: You can also use a package of candy melts. Melt the candy or chocolate in 10-second increments and stir until it is liquefied. You will need to work quickly to assemble your cupcake shoes before the chocolate dries. The chocolate is the glue of your cupcake.

steps.headline: Scoop a slight indentation into the side of one of your cupcakes with a teaspoon.
steps.description: It should be a small horizontal scoop where the cake and frosting meet the liner. Take away no more than one-half tsp. of cake. Your spoon should scoop slightly below the edge of the liner, so that the liner will hold the platform in place.

steps.headline: Place the cupcake on the baking sheet.
steps.description: Insert the wide end of the graham cracker platform into the cupcake, where you made your indentation. Push until it feels fairly secure and hold it in place with your left hand. Make sure your place your graham cracker with the frosted side up.

steps.headline: Dip the angled top of the pirouette cookie into the melted chocolate with your right hand.
steps.description:
Set the flat end on the baking sheet. Attach the angled end to the top of the graham cracker platform with the melted chocolate “glue.”
Ensure you use enough chocolate so that it will harden like glue. However, don’t use so much that it will drip down the cookie. Hold it until you feel it is secure, and then leave it to dry.

steps.headline: Repeat with each of your dozen cupcakes.
steps.description: Let them dry for several hours. Then, decorate them with additional piping or cake decorations before serving.

text:
Making Cupcakes Decide what color you want your cupcake heels to be. Use white if you want to simplify the process, since you won’t need to color your frosting. Choose red, yellow, purple, blue or any other color. Brown shoes can be made using chocolate frosting, rather than coloring white frosting. Purchase cupcake liners in a matching color or pattern. The liners make up the platform of your heel, so they should be color coordinated to your frosting and decorations. Buy coordinating sprinkles. Try something that matches the color of your frosting. You can also use toasted coconut. Mix your cake batter according to the package directions. Preheat your oven to the temperature specified. Line your cupcake pan with your colored cupcake liners. If you are using chocolate cake mix, but you don’t want your cupcake shoes to appear brown, use two cupcake liners for each cupcake. The oil in the cake can seep through the liner and make it opaque. Bake your cupcakes according to the package directions. Test them by poking a metal skewer into the center. If it comes out clean it is done. Set the cupcakes to cook for one hour. Your cupcakes should be at room temperature before you try to frost them. Set them atop a mesh cooling rack to help them cool off faster. Coloring Frosting Scoop the white frosting into a bowl.  Color your frosting to match the cupcake liners and sprinkles. Visit the Food Network’s Frosting by Numbers page to learn how to mix almost any color with traditional liquid food coloring. You can also purchase gel food coloring at craft stores or online. It is pre-mixed to a certain hue and it can result in more vibrant colors. This is the best option if you want to make red or black frosting. Mix the frosting well with a spoon until all of the food coloring is combined.  Frost each of the cupcakes in an even layer with a rubber spatula. You can also pipe the frosting onto the top of the cupcake if you are experienced with cake decorating. Pour your sprinkles or coconut flakes into a bowl. Dip the top of your iced cupcake into the sprinkles. They should be covered in an even layer, which will create the “fabric” of your shoe. Constructing Cupcake Shoes Place a large baking sheet on a flat surface nearby. This is where you will leave the finished product to dry. Tailor your graham crackers. Take a rectangular piece of cracker from the box. Use a serrated knife to saw the graham cracker into an angled shoe platform. You will need a base to connect with the cupcake and a thinner top edge to connect with the heel. It will look like a long, thin triangle; however, both ends should have square sides for added support. Repeat with your 11 remaining graham crackers. Some crackers may fracture, so have extra on hand. Ice the top of the graham cracker with your colored icing. Extend the icing along the edges of the cracker. Dip each edge of the graham cracker into the bowl of sprinkles. The sprinkles should look like the perimeter of the shoe. You can also pipe matching frosting or decorative beads onto the edges of the cracker. Set your iced crackers aside until you are ready for final assembly. Cut your pirouette cookies. Cut the top of the Russian cigarette cookies into an angle. The graham cracker platform will rest on the top of the cookie. The shorter and more stout the cookies are, the sturdier the stiletto will be. Melt white chocolate chips in the microwave with a little water. You can also use a package of candy melts. Melt the candy or chocolate in 10-second increments and stir until it is liquefied. You will need to work quickly to assemble your cupcake shoes before the chocolate dries. The chocolate is the glue of your cupcake. Scoop a slight indentation into the side of one of your cupcakes with a teaspoon. It should be a small horizontal scoop where the cake and frosting meet the liner. Take away no more than one-half tsp. of cake. Your spoon should scoop slightly below the edge of the liner, so that the liner will hold the platform in place. Place the cupcake on the baking sheet. Insert the wide end of the graham cracker platform into the cupcake, where you made your indentation. Push until it feels fairly secure and hold it in place with your left hand. Make sure your place your graham cracker with the frosted side up. Dip the angled top of the pirouette cookie into the melted chocolate with your right hand. Set the flat end on the baking sheet. Attach the angled end to the top of the graham cracker platform with the melted chocolate “glue.”
Ensure you use enough chocolate so that it will harden like glue. However, don’t use so much that it will drip down the cookie. Hold it until you feel it is secure, and then leave it to dry. Repeat with each of your dozen cupcakes. Let them dry for several hours. Then, decorate them with additional piping or cake decorations before serving.
